contentList.comment: Damage description that covered Strength, Finesse and Intelligence in Vanilla
contentList.content: Increases your damage by 3% per point and allows you to lift and carry heavier items.
Gives you 2% dodge and increases your movement speed by 0.1 m per point.
Increases your Chance to Hit by 2% per point.
Increases your Critical Chance and your ability to detect traps and find hidden treasures.
Skills for healing, buffing and protecting allies.
Skills for polymorphing, bending and summoning.
Allows the usage of Heavy Armor
Increases the damage reduction obtained from Armor.
Increases your Concentration Cap by 1 per point.

Increases the range from your ranged skills.

This range increase affects ranged weapon attacks, dome, jump, multistrike, projectile, projectile strike, rain, rush, storm, summon, ranged target, teleportation, tornado and wall skills. Doesnâ€™t increase the range on melee weapon attacks, cone, quake, shout, melee target and zone skills.
Increases the healing and armor restorations caused by you.
Next Level [1]: +[2]% Vitality healed, +[3]% Magic Armour from skills and potions.
Level [1]: +[2]% Vitality healed, +[3]% Magic Armour from skills and potions.
Increases your summons base stats and attributes. Upon reaching 5 Summoning, your summons gain increased size and more attributes.
Next Level [1]: Summons start with [2]% more Vitality, Damage, and Armour.
Level [1]: Summons start with [2]% more Vitality, Damage, and Armour.
Heal yourself for a portion of the damage you deal to the target's Vitality.
Vanilla's Lone Wolf is no longer available
Damage is based on your level and receives bonus from Strength.
Damage is based on your attack and receives a bonus from Strength.
Damage may be reduced by resistances.
The stats of the summons will depend on the caster's level and attributes.
Huntsman skills advance archers and rangers. A high level of Finesse improves these skills' reach, while Strength improves their damage. Read this book to learn this skill.
Warfare skills are skills for warriors. High Strength improves some of these skills. Read this book to learn this skill.

Conjure a personal elemental that matches the ground surface it's summoned onto. Your Incarnate can be buffed with Infusions. Once you hit Summoning ability level of 5, a colossal Incarnate Champion will answer your summons!
[1] characters suffer damage from all healing effects - including potions - but gain 50% Lifesteal. They cannot benefit from Blessed. In combat, their Bless skill also becomes its opposite...
Characters with Braveheart are considered a priority target by enemies in melee, but cannot flee from combat. In addition, attacks of opportunity provoke immediate retaliation from Braveheart.

[1] gives all magical skills a critical chance equal to your critical chance score.

This talent is added to all characters during combat by default.

[1] gives you the ability to perform attacks of opportunity.

This talent is added to all characters during combat by default.

[1] permits your character [2] AP worth of free movement per turn.

This talent is added to all characters during combat by default.
[1] lets you heal from poison, but regular healing will damage you instead.

With [1], the duration of damage statuses caused by you is extended by one turn. Burning, Poisoned, Bleeding, Necrofire, Acid, Suffocating, Entangled, Death Wish, Shackles of Pain and Ruptured Tendons are affected by this talent.
Hydrosophist skills are Water-based magic spells. High Strength improves these skills' damage. Read this book to learn this skill.
Willpower increased. Attacking enemies will become Chilled.
[1] equally distributes statuses you successfully receive to all other characters within 3m.
[1] absorbs blood surfaces to heal you and restores a small amount of Vitality when any nearby character dies.
[1] refunds used skillbooks. In combat, using three skills of the same school in a row restores 1 Action Point.
[1] reduces the cost of using grenades and scrolls by [2] AP when your offhand is free. Additionally, your first equipment change per turn costs nothing.
[1] enables you to talk to animals. Beasts of the wild will occasionally come to your aid when you strike a foe.
[1] gives you +[2]% extra Vitality and +2% to all Resistances (including physical) for every point in Warfare.

A character with [1] has an extra [2]% [3], but takes a [4]% penalty to [5]. Demon gives an additional +3% Fire Resistance each time a Pyrokinetic spell is cast, while Ice King gives immunity to Chilled, Frozen and Slipping.
[1] gives you [2]% Dodging while dual wielding. When missed by an attack in close range, you retaliate.
While sneaking, [1] increases attack damage by [2]% and causes attacks to inflict Atrophy. Also reduces cost of entering sneak mode by [3] AP.
[1] increases the range of skills and scrolls by [2]m and boosts your damage by 10%. Enemy characters within 4 meters decrease your damage by 20%, however.
[1] gives you [2]% chance to recover a special arrow after shooting it, and a separate [2]% chance to immediately repeat a special arrow attack.
Chance of Frost Aegis, which protects the wearer against statuses.
